name: AIDS
description: Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome (AIDS) is the most advanced stage of infection with Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV). It damages the immune system, specifically CD4 cells (T cells), making the body vulnerable to opportunistic infections and cancers.
symptoms: Recurring fever or profuse night sweats
Prolonged swelling of the lymph glands
Sores of the mouth, anus, or genitals

early_stage.description: Acute HIV Infection: Occurs 2-4 weeks after infection. Flu-like symptoms (fever, rash, headache). High viral load and very contagious.

middle_stage.description: Clinical Latency (Chronic HIV): Virus is active but reproduces at low levels. Asymptomatic or mild symptoms. Can last decades with treatment.

advanced_stage.description: AIDS: Severe damage to the immune system (CD4 < 200 cells/mmÂ³). Occurrence of opportunistic infections (e.g., Kaposi's sarcoma, pneumocystis pneumonia).

causes: Caused by the Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV). It destroys CD4 T lymphocyte cells, which are crucial to the immune system.

favorable_conditions.humidity: Does not survive long in environment
favorable_conditions.environment: Spreads via direct contact with specific body fluids

impact.prevalence: Approx. 39 million people globally living with HIV (2022)
impact.socio_economic_impact: Major global health burden, though managed effectively with ART; stigma and discrimination remain challenges.

diagnosis.field_diagnosis: Rapid antibody tests (oral fluid or fingerstick)
diagnosis.laboratory_diagnosis: ELISA/Western Blot, Nucleic Acid Tests (NAT) for viral load, CD4 count monitoring.

susceptible_populations: Populations with high-risk behaviors, infants of untreated mothers.
life_cycle: Retrovirus life cycle: binding, fusion, reverse transcription, integration, replication, assembly, and budding.

dataset_metadata.intended_use: Machine learning training, research, and educational purpose
